Articles.Content:
suddenly all my stock contacts have vanished, or at least the ones that you get at the start of the game some that seem to go with mods, im not sure what mod this comes from and have updated them all, i also already tried installing ATM Basic since someone said it fixed a similar error. im not sure what to do now other than post my output here,

Output Log: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/pmo4dh9elwy1gj3/AAAx3BDCtVKw8tNy2sidvGdta?dl=0

the image is my game data folder, the only mods i have not showing in there are KAX and DarkMultiPlayer

really hoping someone can help but thank you to anyone who even takes the time
There isn't an output log in that link.

IF you have contract configurator, Texture Replacer with default settings, AND another mod that has a flag in .png format, and do NOT have Active Texture Management, then this can happen (it may have been fixed in the latest versions of Contract Configurator, not certain). Possible fixes are to install Active Texture Management, or change the settings in Texture Replacer to exclude the flag directory.

IF you have contract configurator, Texture Replacer with default settings, AND another mod that has a flag in .png format, and do NOT have Active Texture Management, then this can happen (it may have been fixed in the latest versions of Contract Configurator, not certain). Possible fixes are to install Active Texture Management, or change the settings in Texture Replacer to exclude the flag directory.

Actually, it's fixed in the latest Texture Replacer (but he's not using it, and has ATM, so it's not that issue). The other common cause of this is if you tried to do a blind DDS conversion on your GameData dir and converted agency icons that shouldn't have been converted. Beyond that, we'd need a log file to do much more than guessing.
really sorry guys my bad, it should be there now

Can't say why this would cause contract issues, but you've got this error about a million times in your log file:

IsolatedStorageException: Could not find a part of the path "D:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\CIT\ActiveStruts\Plugins\ActiveStruts.cfg".  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, Boolean anonymous, FileOptions options) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.File.Open (System.String path, FileMode mode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ConfigNode.Save (System.String fileFullName, System.String header) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ConfigNode.Save (System.String fileFullName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ActiveStruts.Util.Config._initialSave () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ActiveStruts.Util.Config..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ActiveStruts.Util.Config.get_Instance () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ActiveStruts.Addons.ActiveStrutsAddon._processUpdate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ActiveStruts.Addons.ActiveStrutsAddon.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

Could be that's the problem, or could be the real issue is hiding somewhere in the log but too hard to find because of all the log spam. Either way I'd try reinstalling/removing active struts.
thats weird, i dont have CIT installed, so im guessing i got another mod that needs it and didnt notice, im gonna try installing that, is there any way to refresh my output log after that?
